ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course and a must-take for anyone who has been or wants to go Italy or is learning Italian. Professor Snowden, who a lot of people already know from Epidemic Diseases, is an awesome and underrated professor. He makes an effort to get to know his students--take him up on his offer and go to the Italian breakfasts.
Take it. It was fun and not a terrible amount of work. Snowden is very helpful and great.

Italy Since 1900 was a really enjoyable class. It really wasn't too much work (one take home final, section, a 7 page paper, and a final) and was very straightforward. Professor Snowden really loves Italian history and you can't help but get excited after listening to his lectures. Overall, its a fun class with not too much work and you learn a lot of interesting history.

Definitely take it. Snowden is fascinating and brings in so many different facets of Italian history. Movies are also really great. Workload is manageable- take-home midterm, final, movie paper and 1 or 2 reading responses. Seems like a lot of reading but a lot of it is fairly optional as it usually get covered in class.

History of Italy is a great survey course on modern Italian history. Great class to take if you've taken Italian language and are looking for a related class. Also great to take if you're interested in Italian film as you watch about 5-6 films throughout the course. Professor Snowden is great and makes the material very interesting.
